reviews.review: This is a great survival/horror game. Playing with randoms can be frustrating sometimes because team work is key to winning as a survivor. There are updates regularly to help keep it from getting stale. The DLC is a bit pricey for me, but I have a lot of fun without it.

반드시 스트리머들 게임 영상들 시청 후 어떤 식으로 게임 전략을 짜는지 어떻게 행동하는지 타이밍 같은 것들을 눈으로라도 익히고 오십쇼. 

+개발자들 볍쉰이라 업데이트 할때마다 거의 겜 재설치 수준으로 시간 잡아먹음 빡침. 
+갈수록 핵에 트롤에 나보다 랭크 높은데 실력은 바닥에서 기는 뉴비랑 매칭됨 빡침. 
+점점 뻐킹 mmr때문에 솔큐는 하기 힘들어짐 빡침. 
+대부분 다인큐 욕하는데 난 다인큐보다 티배깅 비매너들이 훨씬 빡침. 
+첫 평가를 4백 몇시간때 썼는데 지금은 추천은 못하겠다...

This game is a great alternative for Friday The 13th if you hate too much open space or too many survivors to kill, this is better in mechanics, killer variety and perks that can change gameplay. But bugs are considerably common and can cause frustration along side with toxic player and the "requirement" to buy DLC to keep up with the game meta (but the survivors and killers in the original purchase with no DLC is already good enough and can sustain the player to Rank 1). Overall, great game!

La verdad es que me gusta bastante el juego, aunque tiene cosas bastante broken, pero eso suele pasar en todo los juegos, y de cierta manera uno logra lidear con ello. Pero con lo que no puedo lidear, es con los multiples bugs que tiene el juego, y que muchas veces llegan a ser frustrantes e irritantes. Uno de los más recurrentes es el bug del escape; lo cual igual es irónico siendo que es un juego de supervivencia :V, pero que el supervivente no pueda escapar después de toda la partida PLS. Y eso, me gustaría que arreglaran algunas interacciones que dejan bastante que desear, como hitbox, interacciones con palets, etc... Pero eso, por favor, esos bugs son bastante comunes, y es algo que desencanta del juego. Por ahora dejo mi like, pero es eso, por ahora.

Way too f**king easy for the killer.  Easier than playing Jason in Friday the 13th.  They stack the entire deck against the survivors.  Haven't played this since launch (because of game breaking bugs), and thought I'd come back to it.  The killers used to at least be slow, now on top of having speed, they also have a ton of mobility powers and invisibility, etc.  Like I said, the game is completely stacked against survivors.  At least give survivors more defensive options to balance how much killers have been buffed.  

It looks like killers have been buffed and buffed and survivors have changed barely at all.  The problem with this game is that the burden is already entirely on the survivors (don't even get me started on the stupid skill checks) and has only been increasing.  They should rename this title to Middle Class America Simulator 2019.

For example, as a survivor, you get no kind of "invisibility" or camo power.  Sure you can crouch, but you stick out like a sore thumb against the environment, plus the maps are incredibly too small.  

  Yet one of the killers can cloak and has a stealth mode.

 This game is basically hide and seek and they give the seeker the stealth / cloaking ability.  On top of this some killers have abilities (The Doctor?), to just find you where ever you are hidden.

  The game is hide and seek and they give the people trying to hide almost nothing, and give the seeker the ability to hide while seeking.  Think about that if you want an understanding of how dumb the balance in this game is.

Great game. Sure, it's got some balancing issues, but it looks like it's come a long way over the last couple years as far as eliminating bugs. Criminally underrated and is the type of game that you could put hundreds of hours into. Wish I would have bought this game much sooner.

unbalanced piece of shit

I absolutely love playing this game with friends. Though there are balance issues, unsportsmanlike players, and the occasional  bugs, it's still one of my favorites. It's really hard to balance all the perks in this game. People are going to find perk combinations and either become unstoppable survivors, or unstoppable killers. The game doesn't lean in favor of the killer or the survivors, it's up to how you play and what perks you use.

Personal pros:
- you only need 5 friends to have this game to make a full lobby (4 survivors, 1 killer)
- your bloodpoints are shared between ALL characters. Usable for different killers and survivors. It makes leveling up easier if you want to play your level 30 character to earn bloodpoints to use on your level 5.
- some killers are genuinely terrifying to play against. I don't mean difficulty, I mean actual fear. I can't explain how, but being chased down a long hallway by a maniac wielding a chainsaw, charging after you at mach 3, and you narrowly escape by jumping through a window gives me a rush.

Personal cons:
- there will be times when you hook a player, and they'll leave the game. I'm unsure of what the punishment is for this, but whatever it is, it's not enough because it happens about 10% of the time for me.
- some killers do feel really unbalanced. The Nurse for instance, she can teleport through the barricades you throw down behind you. As a survivor, throwing that barricade down to try to block the killer's way or stun them is your only actual defense. Being able to ignore it all together is a bit much.
- if you're playing killer, and you match against a team of 4 players that are partied together and using discord, it makes the game at least 10x more difficult. The communication between them is a huge advantage against the killer. You can still get one or two of them, but you'll struggle to get them all.

All things considered, I recommend this game. I think it's really fun to play if you're not trying to play super serious all the time. If you're trying to survive every game or kill everyone every game, you won't enjoy it. Try to win, but don't get mad if you lose, and you'll have fun.
